alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 1:41PM MST until February 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches are expected along and south of US Highway 12. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches are expected near the North Dakota and South Dakota border. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Brown County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light to occasionally moderate snow is expected on Monday night into Tuesday, with a few inches of additional snowfall accumulation possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
